root.text: in what situation would a runner_status be "HIDDEN"?

elements.text: in what situation would a runner_status be "HIDDEN"?

text: we make runners hidden in Antepost markets when they don’t proceed through a nomination or acceptance stage. It turns the matched odds of a bet to 1.0, which means the backer’s stake is still held in the market, but layers get their liability returned as available funds to bet. We don’t partially settle runners as losers in these cases, as that would result in the layer receiving the backer’s stake as winnings, because of the very small chance that a horse could actually re-nominate or end up in the final field, despite being ruled out at the earlier point. Antepost Non-runners are then ‘unhidden’ and settled as losers once the race has actually been run.
